Dear cantera users/developers,

since some time I am struggling with a Cant=
era/Matlab interface
problem that has been previously discussed here withou=
t reasonable
outcome. Maybe some of you know better today and can help me.
=

My intention is to compute a multiphase equilibrium under Matlab (I
need t=
o use Matlab to integrate the simulation in an existing model),
but always =
the same MEX-file error occurs (The error has been
thoroughly described in =
this thread before). 

Meanwhile I have tried several Matlab/Cantera config=
urations but even
under newest Matlab 7.4 and Cantera 1.7 the problem is st=
ill existent.
For installation of all cantera versons I have always used th=
e
provided binary installers.

Besides I have tried to build Cantera with V=
isual C++.NET as
recommanded by Prof. Goodwin before (closely following the=
 instruction
in the documentation). 
However the building process in C++ is=
 constantly abandoned during
Matlab configuration (error-message below). Ag=
ain a failure due to a
problem with input files.

_________________________=
___________________________________________________________________________=
__________________________________________________________
"link /out:"ctme=
thods.mexw32" /dll /export:mexFunction /MAP
/LIBPATH:"C:\PROGRA~1\MATLAB\R2=
007a\extern\lib\win32\microsoft"
libmx.lib libmex.lib libmat.lib
/implib:C:=
\DOKUME~1\ADMINI~1\LOKALE~1\Temp\mex_B2D7AC69-483B-442F-D092-0EFAB7A0D34C\t=
emplib.x
/MACHINE:X86 kernel32.lib user32.lib gdi32.lib winspool.lib
comdlg=
32.lib advapi32.lib shell32.lib ole32.lib oleaut32.lib uuid.lib
odbc32.lib =
odbccp32.lib 
@C:\DOKUME~1\ADMINI~1\LOKALE~1\Temp\mex_B2D7AC69-483B-442F-D0=
92-0EFAB7A0D34C\mex_tmp.rsp
 " 
 
 
  C:\PROGRA~1\MATLAB\R2007A\BIN\MEX.PL:=
 Error: Link of
'ctmethods.mexw32' failed. 
 
??? Error using =3D=3D> mex a=
t 206
Unable to complete successfully.

Error in =3D=3D> buildwin at 4
mex =
-v -I../../../build/include private/ctmethods.cpp ...
_____________________=
_________________________________________________________________

Has anyo=
ne an idea to overcome those difficulties with the Matlab
function >Mixture=
.m<?
Is it helpful to build your own Cantera installer with C++ or does the=

same problems with function Mixture in Matlab still occur?

Thanks for you=
r support
Sebastian



--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Dave Goodwin" <dgoo=
dwin@...> wrote:
>
> All I can think of is that this may be an incompatibil=
ity between
how MATLAB Cantera MEX 
> file is compiled and how MATLAB itsel=
f is compiled.  I would
recommend building Cantera 
> from source code usin=
g Visual C++ .NET with the development version
(CVS) of Cantera 
> and see =
if this fixes the problem.  Or just wait a day or so until
Cantera 1.7.0 is=
 released, 
> which I have verified to work with MATLAB under Windows at le=
ast on
my system. 
> 
> For what it's worth, Python seems to be less suscep=
tible to such
errors than MATLAB.  
> 
> Dave
> 
>
